name: Lanthwaite Wood and Crummock Water Walk

ai.summary: Lanthwaite Wood and Crummock Water Walk is a scenic 14.9 km loop in the Lake District that combines shaded woodland trails through Lanthwaite Wood with tranquil lakeside paths along Crummock Water. The route offers a moderate challenge with mixed surfaces, giving walkers a blend of woodland shade, water views, and gentle hill sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily well-marked trails through Lanthwaite Wood and along Crummock Water's shore. Expect a mix of smooth forest paths, compact gravel, exposed lakeside sections, and some gentle ascents and descents. In wet weather the trails can be muddy and slippery, especially near stream crossings and roots.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather; wear sturdy waterproof hiking boots and dress in layers; carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a fully charged phone. Stay on marked paths, tell someone your planned return time, and start early in short daylight months. Be prepared for mud, wind near the water, and potential slips on roots or rocks; bring a first-aid kit and sufficient water and snacks.
recommended_gear: Extra mid-layers and a hat/gloves for variable weather
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone and portable charger
Sunscreen, sunglasses, and a hat for sun protection
Headlamp or flashlight (for potential late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October), with the most favorable conditions typically from late spring to early autumn when daylight is longer and rain is less frequent.

seo.title: Lanthwaite Wood and Crummock Water Walk – 14.9 km Moderate Lake District Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore Lanthwaite Wood and Crummock Water in a 14.9 km Lake District loop. A moderate hike with woodland trails, lakeside sections, practical safety tips, and a gear checklist.
seo.h1: Lanthwaite Wood and Crummock Water Walk (14.9 km, Moderate)
